issue.title: GDD type to select something from CasparCG server
issue.body:
Sometimes one needs to be able to select an image, clip or dataset from CasparCG server. Maybe we could add GDD types for that. These would be exclusive for Caspar, as it does not make sense for vMix etc. 

Maybe these listings could also be restricted to a sub-folder in Caspar. So, for instance, that the user can only choose images pr clips in one server folder, that are put there (by some external process) to be used for that purpose. Possible scenario: over the shoulder graphic or clip in news.

To be able to select a dataset is use full in situations where a system does only allow templates to have variables (MOS). The template would then invoke an update command to itself with the given dataset.

comment.body:
You bring up some good points!

It believe that some of this should be covered in how a client chooses to implement the gddTypes `file-path` or `file-path/image-path`.
It cannot not be up to the template to know in what context or what system it is going to be rendered in, but that is something the playout client would know, so it should be able to determine that for example: "This template is going to be rendered in CasparCG, so the files that I'm going to let the user pick from will be in the template folder".


The ability to restrict selection to some kind of a sub-folder would be a nice addition to the `file-path` and `file-path/image-path` though!

issue.title: Feat: Scheduled playout
issue.body:
This is a **large PR** that adds "Scheduling"-functionality to playout.

To make it work, the implementation touches most of the playout-logic.

Features:

* New property on Group: **Playout Mode**, where Normal is the default (this makes playout work as it does today).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15196563/186584763-fd1a10a7-205b-40ce-95f6-31e53db15c01.png)
* **Scheduled playout**
![Image](https://media.giphy.com/media/kR4y9wqhm4Ies3p7eI/giphy.gif)
  * User can select a Start Time
  * User can select various Repeating modes (Daily, Weekly, Monthly or Custom)
* When a Part has started playing from a schedule, user can still Pause, Stop or Play it.
  * To resume a schedule after a stop, click disable then enable schedule.

TODO:

- [x] Test that this doesn't break anything, playout-wise

comment.body: Yeah that would be useful! Could you open a separate issue for that feature request please? 🙂

review.body:
I have a couple of notes:

1. If there are no Analog Inputs set up (which is the most common case) nothing happens when clicking the button. I think that we should either:
  1a. Hide the button if there are no Analog Inputs set up (think about potential GUI performance here).
  1b. Display some link of info in the popup to educate the user about the possibility.
2. When there is an analog input assigned, the button changes color: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15196563/198593557-fabbe034-e3f2-4bc2-9e81-b8f7ed427266.png)
This isn't ideal for visually impaired, could we also change the icon or do something that changes the shape of it?

pull_request.title: Feat/stronger ddp call typings in gateways
pull_request.body:
* **What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)

feat

* **What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?**

This improves the type safety of some gateway code. Method calls are now typed, using the same api interface as is used by core.

Various other tidying was done to make bits more type safe where possible, using types in `shared-lib`.

The `studioOfDevice` publication has been removed, as it was used solely by playout-gateway to verify that the studio existed, before attempting to load the RoutedTimeline and RoutedMappings from the subscribed collections. This check has no purpose, as if the studioId was invalid, then meteor would have served an empty collection.
I have checked, and the tv2 inews gateway does not appear to use this publication.

* **Other information**:

I have given a quick test of both playout and mos gateways and they appear to be happy. A more thorough test is needed

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,11 @@ _Note: All of the properties inside of `gddPlayoutOptions` are optional._
         /** The default / suggested layer to play on */
         "layer"?: number
 
+        /** A list of the commands supported by the template, can be displayed as buttons */
+        "commands": ["play", "next", "stop", "update", "(custom invokes)"]
+        /** A template should support "play" and "stop" as a minimum. Some templates are not meant to be updated when already */
+        /** played, so they shall not support "update". Some templates support invoke comands like "show", "hide", "showOvertime" */
+        /** or anything else. These commands can be used to render (or enable/disable) buttons in the UI. */
comment.body:
I don't think we should be aiming to support existing templates in this specification, so I don't think this is the way to go.

A larger question though is: "how the templates should work"?
The `play()`, `next()`, `stop()`, `update()` pattern is a CasparCG one.
Is that something we should add to the specification in general? Or should that be added to the specification, but under for **CasparCG-templates** only?

issue.title: Consider adding a "slider" hint for "number", "integer", and "percentage" types
issue.body:
Sometimes, numeric inputs are best represented as an input field, other times they are best represented as a slider. It would be neat if there was a way to have a "hint" that one of these properties should be represented as a slider instead of an input field. This could be a progressive enhancement that gracefully falls back to an input field if the UI in question doesn't support sliders.

Use of a slider would require the presence of minimum and maximum values.

comment.body: Agreed, in the generic sense I think this should be up to the GUI to decide (using the minimum/maximum properties as hints) or a separate GDDType for a specific type of input

pull_request.title: Add GDD Type invoke-action
pull_request.body:
This PR adds a special GDD Type called "invoke-cction".

The intention is to allow the user to click on buttons in the GUI to INVOKE custom functions in the template (this is a fairly common use case for CasparCG templates).


Co-authored by imaretic <ivan.maretic@live.com>
Co-authored by Tuomo Kulomaa <tuomo@smartpx.fi>

pull_request.title: Add GDD Type invoke-action
pull_request.body:
This PR adds a special GDD Type called "invoke-cction".

The intention is to allow the user to click on buttons in the GUI to INVOKE custom functions in the template (this is a fairly common use case for CasparCG templates).


Co-authored by imaretic <ivan.maretic@live.com>
Co-authored by Tuomo Kulomaa <tuomo@smartpx.fi>

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -367,6 +367,30 @@ Example:
 }
 ```
 
+### Special GDD Type: "Invoke Action"
+
+Some templates support invoking custom functions during their life-time.
+This GDD Type should be rendered as a Button in the GUI so that the user can click it to invoke the action.
+
+
+Example:
+```typescript
+{
+  "title": string, // [Mandatory] A short title / label of the action
+  "description": "", // [Optional] A longer description of the action
+  "type": "null",
+  "gddType": "invoke-action",
+  "gddOptions": {
+    // [mandatory] The function to invoke in the template
comment.body:
Good point!
I've improved the description a tad now.
The `invoke` property is supposed to contain the script being executed in the target template,  `myCustomHello("someArg0")`

issue.title: GDD type to select something from CasparCG server
issue.body:
Sometimes one needs to be able to select an image, clip or dataset from CasparCG server. Maybe we could add GDD types for that. These would be exclusive for Caspar, as it does not make sense for vMix etc. 

Maybe these listings could also be restricted to a sub-folder in Caspar. So, for instance, that the user can only choose images pr clips in one server folder, that are put there (by some external process) to be used for that purpose. Possible scenario: over the shoulder graphic or clip in news.

To be able to select a dataset is use full in situations where a system does only allow templates to have variables (MOS). The template would then invoke an update command to itself with the given dataset.

comment.body:
You bring up some good points!

It believe that some of this should be covered in how a client chooses to implement the gddTypes `file-path` or `file-path/image-path`.
It cannot not be up to the template to know in what context or what system it is going to be rendered in, but that is something the playout client would know, so it should be able to determine that for example: "This template is going to be rendered in CasparCG, so the files that I'm going to let the user pick from will be in the template folder".


The ability to restrict selection to some kind of a sub-folder would be a nice addition to the `file-path` and `file-path/image-path` though!

comment.body:
I agree with this!
I suggest that we name such a thing "layerName" or similar, to emphasize that it is tied to a certain layer.

issue.title: Feat: Scheduled playout
issue.body:
This is a **large PR** that adds "Scheduling"-functionality to playout.

To make it work, the implementation touches most of the playout-logic.

Features:

* New property on Group: **Playout Mode**, where Normal is the default (this makes playout work as it does today).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15196563/186584763-fd1a10a7-205b-40ce-95f6-31e53db15c01.png)
* **Scheduled playout**
![Image](https://media.giphy.com/media/kR4y9wqhm4Ies3p7eI/giphy.gif)
  * User can select a Start Time
  * User can select various Repeating modes (Daily, Weekly, Monthly or Custom)
* When a Part has started playing from a schedule, user can still Pause, Stop or Play it.
  * To resume a schedule after a stop, click disable then enable schedule.

TODO:

- [x] Test that this doesn't break anything, playout-wise

comment.body: Yeah that would be useful! Could you open a separate issue for that feature request please? 🙂

review.body:
I have a couple of notes:

1. If there are no Analog Inputs set up (which is the most common case) nothing happens when clicking the button. I think that we should either:
  1a. Hide the button if there are no Analog Inputs set up (think about potential GUI performance here).
  1b. Display some link of info in the popup to educate the user about the possibility.
2. When there is an analog input assigned, the button changes color: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15196563/198593557-fabbe034-e3f2-4bc2-9e81-b8f7ed427266.png)
This isn't ideal for visually impaired, could we also change the icon or do something that changes the shape of it?

pull_request.title: Feat/stronger ddp call typings in gateways
pull_request.body:
* **What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)

feat

* **What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?**

This improves the type safety of some gateway code. Method calls are now typed, using the same api interface as is used by core.

Various other tidying was done to make bits more type safe where possible, using types in `shared-lib`.

The `studioOfDevice` publication has been removed, as it was used solely by playout-gateway to verify that the studio existed, before attempting to load the RoutedTimeline and RoutedMappings from the subscribed collections. This check has no purpose, as if the studioId was invalid, then meteor would have served an empty collection.
I have checked, and the tv2 inews gateway does not appear to use this publication.

* **Other information**:

I have given a quick test of both playout and mos gateways and they appear to be happy. A more thorough test is needed

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,11 @@ _Note: All of the properties inside of `gddPlayoutOptions` are optional._
         /** The default / suggested layer to play on */
         "layer"?: number
 
+        /** A list of the commands supported by the template, can be displayed as buttons */
+        "commands": ["play", "next", "stop", "update", "(custom invokes)"]
+        /** A template should support "play" and "stop" as a minimum. Some templates are not meant to be updated when already */
+        /** played, so they shall not support "update". Some templates support invoke comands like "show", "hide", "showOvertime" */
+        /** or anything else. These commands can be used to render (or enable/disable) buttons in the UI. */
comment.body:
I don't think we should be aiming to support existing templates in this specification, so I don't think this is the way to go.

A larger question though is: "how the templates should work"?
The `play()`, `next()`, `stop()`, `update()` pattern is a CasparCG one.
Is that something we should add to the specification in general? Or should that be added to the specification, but under for **CasparCG-templates** only?

issue.title: Consider adding a "slider" hint for "number", "integer", and "percentage" types
issue.body:
Sometimes, numeric inputs are best represented as an input field, other times they are best represented as a slider. It would be neat if there was a way to have a "hint" that one of these properties should be represented as a slider instead of an input field. This could be a progressive enhancement that gracefully falls back to an input field if the UI in question doesn't support sliders.

Use of a slider would require the presence of minimum and maximum values.

comment.body: Agreed, in the generic sense I think this should be up to the GUI to decide (using the minimum/maximum properties as hints) or a separate GDDType for a specific type of input

issue.title: Consider adding a "slider" hint for "number", "integer", and "percentage" types
issue.body:
Sometimes, numeric inputs are best represented as an input field, other times they are best represented as a slider. It would be neat if there was a way to have a "hint" that one of these properties should be represented as a slider instead of an input field. This could be a progressive enhancement that gracefully falls back to an input field if the UI in question doesn't support sliders.

Use of a slider would require the presence of minimum and maximum values.

issue.title: GDD type to select something from CasparCG server
issue.body:
Sometimes one needs to be able to select an image, clip or dataset from CasparCG server. Maybe we could add GDD types for that. These would be exclusive for Caspar, as it does not make sense for vMix etc. 

Maybe these listings could also be restricted to a sub-folder in Caspar. So, for instance, that the user can only choose images pr clips in one server folder, that are put there (by some external process) to be used for that purpose. Possible scenario: over the shoulder graphic or clip in news.

To be able to select a dataset is use full in situations where a system does only allow templates to have variables (MOS). The template would then invoke an update command to itself with the given dataset.

comment.body:
You bring up some good points!

It believe that some of this should be covered in how a client chooses to implement the gddTypes `file-path` or `file-path/image-path`.
It cannot not be up to the template to know in what context or what system it is going to be rendered in, but that is something the playout client would know, so it should be able to determine that for example: "This template is going to be rendered in CasparCG, so the files that I'm going to let the user pick from will be in the template folder".


The ability to restrict selection to some kind of a sub-folder would be a nice addition to the `file-path` and `file-path/image-path` though!

issue.title: Feat: Scheduled playout
issue.body:
This is a **large PR** that adds "Scheduling"-functionality to playout.

To make it work, the implementation touches most of the playout-logic.

Features:

* New property on Group: **Playout Mode**, where Normal is the default (this makes playout work as it does today).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15196563/186584763-fd1a10a7-205b-40ce-95f6-31e53db15c01.png)
* **Scheduled playout**
![Image](https://media.giphy.com/media/kR4y9wqhm4Ies3p7eI/giphy.gif)
  * User can select a Start Time
  * User can select various Repeating modes (Daily, Weekly, Monthly or Custom)
* When a Part has started playing from a schedule, user can still Pause, Stop or Play it.
  * To resume a schedule after a stop, click disable then enable schedule.

TODO:

- [x] Test that this doesn't break anything, playout-wise

comment.body: Yeah that would be useful! Could you open a separate issue for that feature request please? 🙂

  1b. Display some link of info in the popup to educate the user about the possibility.
2. When there is an analog input assigned, the button changes color: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15196563/198593557-fabbe034-e3f2-4bc2-9e81-b8f7ed427266.png)
This isn't ideal for visually impaired, could we also change the icon or do something that changes the shape of it?

pull_request.title: Feat/stronger ddp call typings in gateways
pull_request.body:
* **What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)

feat

* **What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?**

This improves the type safety of some gateway code. Method calls are now typed, using the same api interface as is used by core.

Various other tidying was done to make bits more type safe where possible, using types in `shared-lib`.

The `studioOfDevice` publication has been removed, as it was used solely by playout-gateway to verify that the studio existed, before attempting to load the RoutedTimeline and RoutedMappings from the subscribed collections. This check has no purpose, as if the studioId was invalid, then meteor would have served an empty collection.
I have checked, and the tv2 inews gateway does not appear to use this publication.

* **Other information**:

I have given a quick test of both playout and mos gateways and they appear to be happy. A more thorough test is needed

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,11 @@ _Note: All of the properties inside of `gddPlayoutOptions` are optional._
         /** The default / suggested layer to play on */
         "layer"?: number
 
+        /** A list of the commands supported by the template, can be displayed as buttons */
+        "commands": ["play", "next", "stop", "update", "(custom invokes)"]
+        /** A template should support "play" and "stop" as a minimum. Some templates are not meant to be updated when already */
+        /** played, so they shall not support "update". Some templates support invoke comands like "show", "hide", "showOvertime" */
+        /** or anything else. These commands can be used to render (or enable/disable) buttons in the UI. */
comment.body:
I don't think we should be aiming to support existing templates in this specification, so I don't think this is the way to go.

A larger question though is: "how the templates should work"?
The `play()`, `next()`, `stop()`, `update()` pattern is a CasparCG one.
Is that something we should add to the specification in general? Or should that be added to the specification, but under for **CasparCG-templates** only?

issue.title: Consider adding a "slider" hint for "number", "integer", and "percentage" types
issue.body:
Sometimes, numeric inputs are best represented as an input field, other times they are best represented as a slider. It would be neat if there was a way to have a "hint" that one of these properties should be represented as a slider instead of an input field. This could be a progressive enhancement that gracefully falls back to an input field if the UI in question doesn't support sliders.

Use of a slider would require the presence of minimum and maximum values.

comment.body: Agreed, in the generic sense I think this should be up to the GUI to decide (using the minimum/maximum properties as hints) or a separate GDDType for a specific type of input

pull_request.title: Add GDD Type invoke-action
pull_request.body:
This PR adds a special GDD Type called "invoke-cction".

The intention is to allow the user to click on buttons in the GUI to INVOKE custom functions in the template (this is a fairly common use case for CasparCG templates).


Co-authored by imaretic <ivan.maretic@live.com>
Co-authored by Tuomo Kulomaa <tuomo@smartpx.fi>
